title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5319.5 - Tower light
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5319.5 - Tower light

State Regulations
(a) A gaming
device shall have a light, located conspicuously on the top of such device, that illuminates automatically when: (1)
a
player has won an amount or is collecting credits that the device cannot pay
automatically; (2)
an error
condition (including "Door Open") has occurred; or
(3)
a player initiates a "Call

Attendant". (b) For
devices such as "bar-top" games, it is permissible for the tower light to be
shared among other gaming devices or to be substituted by an audible
alarm. (c) The commission may
approve, on a case-by-case basis, alternative means to alert appropriate
personnel in regard to the operation of a gaming device. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
5319.5

Adopted

New

York State Register November 16, 2016/Volume XXXVIII, Issue 46, eff. 11/16/2016

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
